text: BY FAR MY FAVE BREAKFAST IN ALL OF CHI TOWN.  The farmers omelet is stellar. The coconut oatmeal is awesome. They have mini scones to go if you want. The mimosa specials on weekend are great. I just can't say enough good things about this place. I have been here totally sober and sweaty from a workout and I have also been here after marathon St. Pat's drinking at 10pm at night still drunk. I just absolutely love the consistency of this place and I'm so sad I no longer live around the block.  The hashbrowns are perfect please NEVER change them!

We were looking for a casual brunch spot on our trip to Chicago when we saw that this place was just down the street from our hotel. We were immediately greeted when we entered the restaurant and found a spot by the window. The atmosphere felt very down to earth, cozy feeling -- there were many single diners reading the newspaper or a novel while dining.  I ordered an omelette and the waitress asked if I would like my hash browns extra crispy. I didn't think that was an option but I said sure! When the food came, and I tasted the perfect crunch in my mouth, I knew that extra crispy was the best decision I've made that morning. My omelette was delicious and so filling - the portions tend to be on the bigger side, and it's the best bang for your buck.  I left so satisfied and full and would happily return here next time i find myself in the Windy City!
Service was good everyone was friendly, the sand which I ordered was so good. The thick cut BLT on French bread. YUMMMMMMY. I loved the vibe. So Chicago. (Try the Bloody Mary)
Great place! Wonderful service and delicious food. I had the breakfast tacos and it was great.

Breakfast is convenient & close with a rare wait to be seated. Omelets are nice sized portions and pancakes are good. Coffee is very good and service is attentive. I'm satisfied w/ this restaurant and it's many years in the Gold Coast neighborhood. But it is just "good" not great or creative or delicious. I guess I left feeling ... not hungry anymore. Which is a good thing, right ?
An understated gem!!! Breakfast/brunch is a delight here. Great place to hang out with family or friends in a relaxed setting, like a coffee shop or a family run restaurant.
Love the service and the food at dinner is really home cooking at its best. Prices are very reasonable and a great value. Try the pizza it is really tasty and imo of the best in the city.
When visiting Chicago it is our favorite resturant in the neighborhood. Always good food.
Very nice place. I had the quinoa salad with kale last time, and it was extremely good. Perfect combination, very fresh and filling

If I know one anything about weddings, it's that you end up waiting a long time to eat. We decided to be proactive and stuff our faces before we headed to the nuptials.  If you are staying at Hotel Indigo, I would definitely recommend 3rd Coast Cafe for breakfast as it is only a few doors down. We were fortunate to be able to snag a table for two on a busy Saturday morning with no wait! Take a moment to look around as well as local artists have their art on display and for sale.  I had the Greek Omelet (baby spinach, tomato, and feta cheese) with egg whites. ($1.50 extra). I substituted the hash browns for fruit and chose marble rye for my toast. The portion was HUGE and delicious. I only wish that you did not have to specifically request olives. I forgot and I was bummed out when my omelet arrived sans olives. Most Greek omelets come with olives unless you request to NOT have them, not the other way around. Weird.  He had the Pulled Pork Hash which, again, was a huge portion. He said it was very good, albeit very spicy! Keep that in mind if you order it! It came with two eggs and toast.  We split a Mimosa and that was delicious.  Our waitress was MIA for the most part so minus one star for that. It took forever to get the check and I never got a refill. The food was good though and that's the most important thing!

Top notch brunch spot!!!!! The staff and servers are swift, polite, and knowledgeable; the servings are sizable, and the food was delicious!  When I unknowingly left the restaurant with my wallet on the floor under my table, Janet, the store proprietor, went out of her way to track me down by calling my credit card company! She left her personal cell number with the a customer service representative and asked me to call her back so she could drop if off to me since the restaurant was closing for the day!  Not only was the food served hot and indulgent, but the staff is genuinely good hearted, creating the perfect restaurant environment.

Came here this past weekend for brunch. My boyfriend's grandmother lives down the street and swears that this is one of the best brunches in the city. The cafe is situated in the Gold Coast with not much signage, you may miss it. Upon entering the building you step down into the space - most likely filled to the brim with couples, families, and friends. It was busy but we were seated within 10-15 minutes of our arrival (we arrived around 12:15). Now to the food...excellent! We ordered an assortment of omelets and eggs Benedict. I had the farmers omelet, loved every bite.  Great assortment of veggies in every bite. For sides you get fruit/hash browns and toast. I didn't have the hash browns but heard they were good. I'd like to try the lunch or dinner menu. Definitely will be back!

Decided to try this place with my three kids 13,10, &6. The service was great and informative and gave good suggestions. I ordered the veggie hash and it was yummy!!! It was broccoli access veggies chopped up small and put into a the mix with crispy hashbrowns!! Delicious! I want to try this at home.  The two smaller kids ordered pancakes ala carte and my brother got the chicken salad sandwich.... And it was so tasty, interesting, and different.  It had curry, raisins, and apples served on a baguette type bread. The Caesar spinach side salad was great too!  The only thing that didn't float our boat was the tuna melt. It was just okay. It was pretty bland and needed some seasonings or spice.  I would definitely recommend this place and when in Chicago would return!
Very nice café type restaurant we shared the Adam and Eve salad.Then we also shared the Caprese sandwich.  Quick,clean and tasty
This is a comfy neighborhood restaurant with great service. I love their kale and quinoa salad. Very fresh. I have them add chicken for extra protein.
Great "neighborhood" restaurant in the Gold Coast. The best grilled cheese and bacon sandwich I've had. Also, I love the Mexican steak and eggs. Great food.

This is a gem of a restaurant. Upon arriving, my friend and I were greeted and asked where we wanted to sit-instead of seating us in a tiny spot in between some other diners, the woman who was seating us found her most favorite table and gave it to us. "SHE" was the owner, Janet! And was the kindest, sweetest owner I have ever run into.  The food was great and the service was amazing. Yummy omelettes, great eggs, gluten-free toast even! Crispy bacon, and great coffee. I couldn't complain at all! I don't know what the other reviewer was complaining about. Perhaps she was just having a bad day? But come on now. Don't take it out on someone who is a kind person, is more accommodating then she needs to be and has a great business. That's just tacky.

Pretty standard diner fare. Filling and quick food but nothing to get excited about. We ordered an omelette and the French toast. Under-salted omelette and the French toast was okay. Decent coffee. I probably wouldn't return.

I love this restaurant. It's kinda small and cozy. The food is always good and we never have to wait too long. I've only gone for breakfast but it is always very yummy. Sometimes they have different specials so ask about those. I love the coffee too. You might even run into someone famous here! I saw the millionaire match maker once :)

3rd Coast is the definition of a Neighborhood Gem.   One of my favorite spots in the city.  Everything on the menu is excellent.  I frequent 3rd Coast for dinner but their brunch is also delicious.   Their menu features daily food specials with an amazing variety.  They also have daily drink specials, such as $5 Moscow Mule Mondays.   For appetizers, try the Toasted Feta.  The Cajun Chicken Penne, Diablo Beef tacos, the burger (my boyfriend loves the Ghost Burger), and Marinated Chicken sandwich are ALL must trys.  They have a great Apple Pie (a la mode) for dessert too.  We've never had a bad meal or experience here.   AND it is usually not crowded unless it's prime time on Friday & Saturdays;  they often tell you to seat yourself. I joined Yelp so I could write a review on this place.  Must try!

I am lucky I discovered third coast shortly after I moved to Chicago. I come here every chance I get! The food is amazing for brunch, lunch, and dinner, the wine list is incredible, and the staff really makes you feel like you are part of the family. Come here often!

Love this quiet little gem! This history, atmosphere, service and good food make this a go to place in the Gold Coast neighborhood. Breakfast, lunch, dinner, coffee or cocktails - you won't be disappointed.  As you walk into this vintage room, the history can be felt. Local artist's have their talent on display for purchase.  Service has always been top notch on every visit. They know the menu and offer great suggestions. Helpful and polite are always a nice combo! Homemade food and fantastic lattes always satisfy my taste buds. I've had omelettes, soup, salads and sandwiches. Never disappointed.  If you are looking for a quaint neighborhood spot that isn't trendy or a tourist trap - this is the place for you! Sometimes they have live music and drink specials.  A very walkable neighborhood with decent street and garage parking options.
We enjoyed breakfast here during our last day in Chicago. The blueberry scone was delicious!!!

We came here due to the long wait at Three Arts, and it was the best decision we made all day. They were able to seat our party of 7 right away. The service was friendly, fast, and so accommodating. The scones were great, omelets were cooked perfectly, I also highly recommend the breakfast sandwich with the bacon.

I consider this the finest little gem in the Gold Coast. The food is always delicious and fresh. My favorite remains the  Smoked Turkey and Brie sandwich. The staff are always very friendly. They will treat you like an old friend. They are kind, courteous and attentive. There is a wine bar as well as a full cocktail menu. You can't go wrong with the mimosa. If you haven't tried this place, you are missing out. They serve breakfast, lunch and dinner.

Absolutely blew my expectations away - I'd heard nothing but amazing things about this brunch spot and every single one was justified. Came with a friend on Sunday at 11am and had no wait - amazing. Sat down close to the kitchen so it was a bit noisy but nothing unbearable. Ordered a $5 mimosa that was extremely tasty with my blueberry pancakes, pork sausage and scrambled eggs. I knew this place was amazing when they gave me a squirt bottle of syrup - I normally have to beg places for syrup and they gave me a vat! I'd be back here again in a heartbeat. The service was amazing and quick with ridiculously sized portions. I'd go for a 1/2 stack of pancakes - 4 large pancakes were too much for me to finish. Split bill with 2 mimosas and above order came up to $28.

Stumbled upon this gem a few years ago. It was great then and is still great now. It's in a prime location as it's within walking distance from my hotel. Great menu and the portions don't disappoint either. I love the fact that they use hormone free chicken and source their food locally when possible. The food Is made to order but comes out super fast. It's easy to miss as it's located in a building but def a spot I'd recommend.

Love this place! Whether you're writing your best song, screen play or improv sketch you'll love hanging out here. The food is a bonus! I love the chicken salad and other salads. This place flies under the radar for food. Enjoy.

Being the avid brunch-er that I am, I appreciate places like The 3rd Coast that keep brunch chill and eggs-focused rather than have 3 hour waits and overly fancy breakfast fare. I went here last week for a late brunch and really enjoyed it. Service was great and the Bloody Marys were even better. I had a veggie omelet and loved how chock full of veggies it was- not always the case at other places!  I hear The 3rd Coast is a pretty happening wine bar as well in the later hours so I will have to check this place out then and see if it measures up the high bar of brunch! Love how low key and neighbourhoody this place is and I will certainly be back.

A wonderful alternative to Three Arts Club next door. While people are lining up outside to get in, we were able to get a table right away (around 11 am on a Saturday). Waiters were very nice and attentive, so we didn't have as much trouble flagging them down as in other brunch places. Food was delicious and came promptly! Coffee was also great (the latte came in a beer mug: unusual, but appreciate the portion). Even though it was really busy, we stayed quite a while because we were having a really good conversation, and never felt like staff tried to kick us out or we overstayed our welcome. They also use an actual typewriter type of cash register (the "click click" types!) for receipts. Pretty neat and plays into the whole "cool"/"hip" vibe of the bar (yes there is a bar). Definitely would love to come back!

I have been a fan of 3rd Coast since I moved in next door in 1997. The coffee is good, the coronation chicken sandwich is my go to dish.   I moved out of the neighborhood, but still trek there for the cozy vibe.

This is my lunch spot in this area. The owners is such a sweetheart. The staff are friendly and always prompt to greet you.  They have usually two daily soup selections during the day. You can't go wrong with their menu options. The diablo tacos or California salad are my usual selection.  Good beer & wine selection.

This is a great little bruch place. Reasonably priced, good food, and quick service. What might be best about this place is how cozy and "warm" the inside of this place is. It is perfect for conversation and relaxing.

What a great semi-hidden spot! We came here last minute after realizing we were never going to get a seat at the 3 Arts Club and Café. With a party of 9, we were seated immediately. No wait time...just what we wanted. The waitress was very friendly and knowledgeable of the menu and wine selections. We ordered 4 appetizers to start and each one stood out in its own way being equally as delicious as the other. The meatballs with marinara, baked feta cheese, baked goat cheese and mushrooms. I must admit, I went to a restaurant shortly after in hopes that the baked goat cheese there would be as good as it was here. Since the appetizers were so filling, I split a burger with my colleague. The burger had an option to get hash browns. Word of advice, and you will absolutely thank me later....GET THESE HAS BROWNS! They came out crispy on the outside and soft on the inside. SO good. Another plus is that they serve breakfast all day. Win-Win!

Husband and I went here for brunch today. We missed the rush and got seated immediately. There was a decent line when we left. The Benedicto was delicious. I would highly recommend it. The eggs were perfectly poached. Husband said the omelet was good and the hash browns were perfectly cooked. A little on the pricey end for breakfast places but really good food. If the wait staff had been more attentive, this place would have been 5 stars.
Food was great, service was great. Had the Eggs Benedicto, it was cooked perfectly and the Hash was so good! The Irish coffee was awesome. Definitely recommend and would definitely go back!

Came here for brunch during my vacation to Chicago. Definitely had a good meal! I had the Mexican Steak and Eggs, because as a Las Vegas native I have a soft spot for Mexican food no matter where I'm at. This meal did not disappoint. The hash browns were cooked perfectly, the steak was cooked perfectly and seasoned just right. The cheese was nice and melty and the tortillas were warm. I put a little hot sauce on it and went to town. Excellent meal. The best part is that I always ask for my eggs medium, not runny but not hard. I forgot to ask for it on this occasion, and they came out that way anyway. Perfect! My wife had the Pulled Pork Hash, and while it was alright, it was not as good as my meal. The pork is described as having "dry rub seasonings", which is not really the case. I'll tell you exactly what it has: Lawry's Seasoned Salt, and lots of it. That flavor isn't necessarily bad, but it really is all the flavor the pork had. The eggs and potatoes and the rest of the dish were pretty good, she finished it all except the pork, but she did still eat some of the pork. I'm willing to give them a second chance on that pork, it could be that the shaker bottle just got away from them. My steak and eggs were seasoned perfectly so it could be they just had an off day or something. If I stay in the same hotel next time I'm in the city, we will definitely be back to give them a second chance!

Great spot! My friend and I split the coconut oatmeal and we both loved it. The eggs Florentino snd Bobak sausage were also very good. The atmosphere is comfy and the service was quick. Perfect for a Sunday brunch.

Delicious and affordable brunch! We were seated right away at about 10ish on a Saturday morning. It was a homey feel, a good mix of people there. We ordered the turkey and Brie sandwich and the lox Benedict. Both dishes were a success! I thought the turkey and Brie was so delicious by far. The lox Benedict was good. It had salsa verde on it which was a little strange and I could have done without the sauce, but the lox was delicious. I like that fruit or hash browns were both options as sides, so we got one of each. I would highly recommend this for a casual family brunch with good sized portions and a nice environment.
I love this place for a simple breakfast! Their coconut oatmeal is delicious and the vibe of the restaurant is very laid back yet snazzy.

Such a great place to either grab a nice relaxing meal or a quick bite!  I won't highlight specific dishes since I've tried so many in the past 3 months of being in the neighborhood, but I have thoroughly enjoyed every single dish or drink that I've been served with at 3rd Coast.  I do highly recommend either the soup or salad - I get a cup of soup (different varieties) every time I go. Cozy/relaxing atmosphere makes it feel like you're having a home-cooked meal. Friendly staff always greets me with a smile on their face.  They answer ever question that I throw at them regarding the menu with a genuine response.   This might be my new favorite place in town!
I love this place! Every time I visit the area for work I lunch here. It's warm and inviting. The food-especially the daily soups-is always delicious. Don't miss this place. It's great!

I work down the street and the 3rd coast is our favorite lunch spot for carryout. Office favorites: the omelets, marinated chicken sandwich, chopped Cobb salad, and chicken quesadillas. YUM! The carryout is pretty quick usually ready within 10-15 minutes of when we order. And everything is always delicious. Highly recommend the 3rd coast.

Given the location and ambient atmosphere, I was surprised how inexpensive the place was. One of the cheapest mimosas in the area. I would recommend this place for breakfast or lunch. Good for big groups.

Stopped by while walking from Lincoln Park to downtown Chicago (incredibly easy walk by the way) for a quick lunch.  We were borderline hangry and just wanted a place that had good food and was close by and this place came up on yelp.  It did not disappoint! Located on a corner, the windows to the place appear before the door and sign.  Look for it - you won't miss it!  The letters on the windows remind me of the show "Cheers" - maybe because of the old fashioned font?? Service was good, and fast. Kale and quinoa salad was totally absolutely on point with excellent portions.  The dressing on the slide was light by packed with flavor.  I added chicken to the dish and it totally made it super super delicious.  I left full and without an ounce of guilt (yup, practically skipped out of the place now my hangry-ness was cured). My husband had the Diablo sandwich which he really liked (i'm not an au jus sort of person...but he said he was pretty good with good flavor; not the best he's had but pretty good..this is Chicago after all!). Fast, easy, delicious.

This is my favorite spot for brunch. The wait is fairly short and has a nice feel to the place. It's also in a good area. Great service. Food is good. American. Refills on coffee. Nice place to catch up with a friend.
Great food & service!!!  Their food portions are huge!!!  Hardly to finish up half of it... A bottle of mimosa for $25 is a steal....

We stumbled by this place purely by accident. Located next door to our hotel we couldn't decide on where to eat and out of convenience we decided on the 3rd Coast. The place is nicely appointed and comfy with a beautiful wood decor. The menu features all the breakfast staples, burgers, chicken, soups, salads, tacos and bakery items . I get a little  nervous when the kitchen tries to do too much.  That being said, I enjoyed my entree. Ordered the "Diablo Beef" (Italian Beef, Mozzarella, giardiniera and au jus on grilled baguette). The sandwich was loaded with well seasoned beef. The giardiniera brought a ton of heat and the jus calmed everything down. Excellent sandwich. As a side I got maybe the most perfectly cooked Hashbrowns ever.  The service was very slow and the place was not busy. That would be the only thing that keeps this place from being a 5 star.

Had breakfast here on our way to a Cubs game.  We happened upon this great place because we were just trying to avoid the really crowded downtown breakfast spots.  This place definitely didn't disappoint. I am definitely s breakfast snob and their house omelet did not disappoint!  A friend had the Italian omelet and though we all thought it was a little weird to use marinara sauce he really liked it.  Great service, great food, can't go wrong at this neighborhood spot.

After reading all the good reviews we were looking forward to trying this place. However we had a very unpleasant experience. It was a weekday and It was not busy when we arrived but yet, it took 20mins for our server to come and took our order. (There was another lady came in later and got our server's attention quickly). Our server didn't seem happy with us, although we were being polite all the time. He came check with us once, ask if everything were ok and left before we can say anything.  About food: the house omelet with hash browns were average. But the quinoa in the kale & quinoa salad were not fully cooked because I can see the white point in the middle of the quinoa & they were hard to chew. I didn't find anyone else has the problem so I guess it's just me. And I went through all the pictures on Yelp and didn't notice this problem occurred in others' pics. So yeah, I guess I'm the 'lucky one'. We didn't say anything at the restaurant because: 1. Our sever wasn't being so nice. 2. We were in a bit hurry and we already waited 20mins to place our order even though they were not that busy. Overall a very disappointed experience.
Pulled pork hash was off the hook. The pancake on the side was an excellent addition.
This place has upped its breakfast game in recent months and the fact it is tucked out of the way means it is not obnoxiously busy in the morning.  Reasonable prices too!
Quick lunch spot, quiet little hidden evening spot.  Good food and great service.

Excellent service, tasty, well-prepared, and reasonably priced dinner last night at the THIRD COAST Janet, the owner, honored my request and instructed chef to prepare my favorite dish (and healthy)...quinoa pasta with meat balls. ***** Highly Recommended !
Average food at reasonable prices with good wait times on weekends. They also serve gluten free bread as a toast substitute so that's a big plus.

I came here Friday night for a late dinner with a few people.  I had the turkey burger with goat cheese, avocado, red pepper and spinach and it was delicious.  The patty was definitely a frozen patty but the pretzel bun and toppings made up for it.  The hash browns were a little greasy for my liking but you can't beat the price for the area, I'd definitely come back.

We stopped by here for breakfast on a weekday before making our way out to do more touristy things. Their weekend brunch is obviously a lot fancier and more intriguing, but a solid, well executed basic breakfast is also appreciated. Ambiance: Walking in, it was like I stepped back in time. Brass everywhere and there's an old school register at the counter. When we were there, there was a sign to seat ourselves and it reminded me of and old school coffee shop.  Service: Once our waitress came over, you could tell this was a nice, reliable, local go-to spot. Service was friendly, efficient, and professional. Food: We all ordered the Farm Fresh Eggs (with hash browns or fruit, choice of toast). I got my eggs over easy, with fruit, and an english muffin. My eggs were cooked perfectly, the fruit was fresh, and the english muffin hit the spot. Solid place for a good breakfast.

Great little wine bar and cafe. We stopped in for brunch and were quickly seated. The atmosphere is a little dark with all the wood, but it's homey. The breakfast/brunch menu looked great and we ordered the breakfast tacos and bagels and lox. Both were served quickly and were delicious. Definitely recommend this place for a quick bite to eat.

Fantastic food, great vibe, and great service.  We enjoyed the beautiful day at the beach and then walked over here to try it out.  We were very impressed.  I got the smoked turkey and brie with spinach ceaser salad.  It was so good.  We will be back another time to try the vast inventory if wine they have here.
Get the Cajun burger!  Great neighborhood diner with a cool chill vibe.  My go to take out spot!

Solid neighborhood cafe/diner, I liked that they had gluten free bread for their sandwiches. I had the smoked turkey and brie and it was serviceable. The tables are very close together and it can get loud. Also note that they do not have their full regular cafe menu during brunch hours.

We went here for breakfast and it was really delicious. The inside is really cute and homey although I thought the tables were a little close together. Really great brunch menu and the hash browns are awesome. Overall, a good experience.
Great neighborhood diner.  Not fancy but homey and comfortable.  I absolutely love the cooked feta cheese with toast points.   Great for breakfast, lunch and dinner I really like this place  :))

So let me start by saying, that this order is based on a carry out order I made on a Friday night.   Called for carry out for my friend and I, who ordered our meals and was told it would be 20-25 minutes.  As I was visiting her apartment about 5 minutes away, I left after 10 minutes and arrived a bit early.   When I entered the guys at the register were very friendly and welcoming, and even better, had my order ready, 10 minutes early.  The service was great and guys inside were friendly (as stated in prior sentence) and professional and efficient.   The food was excellent.  The hash browns were out of this world with crispness and were hot and flavorful.  All the other food we got was great too.  We decided two bites in, that we would definately be going back to eat in the restaurant soon.
The best key lime pie ever!!! They make it homemade. We ordered the Diablo tacos, and the big bowl Chinese noodle soup. Both were excellent. Service was great! We will definitely be back!

Breakfast collections are smart and comforting without being oily or obnoxious and also you can have an adequate drink without feeling like you have got to perform your ultra-trendy dance for your nearby tavern buddies. It is relaxed and inviting and the waiters and super fine. You do not feel terrible about hanging out and having that long heart to heart with that buddy you are attempting to make up with-- no dirty looks or furious glimpses from workers. Youthful and fresh, however old you are.

So great! Ate here for dinner and came back for breakfast the next morning. Both meals exceeded our expectations. Kinda a stickler on some things. They were hesitant to split the bill between my friend and I. The food and atmosphere were wonderful though!

Came in looking for a savory treat and got just that. I ordered the Feta starter and fell in love it was so good. The feta is warm and covered in olive oil, spices, and herbs and comes with toasted bread. I was so sad I had to share this delicious treat. Seriously, come here for this starter. My sister got a kale salad, which was also nice and had a lovely vinaigrette. But for me it's all about the cheese and bread.
Hidden gem in Gold Coast... Interesting vibe. Feels a little old school/classic diner but decent menu selection and full bar. Feels quaint and cozy.  Food is good and affordable for the area.

The greatest diner-ish spot in the Gold Coast; forever the go-to. Consistently great music (aka good Pandora stations)! Affordable & good drink specials if you go during the week. Note: There is no wi-fi, so not the greatest place to get work done other than reading.

Adorable, cozy, warm and old-school cafe. I wasn't initially greeted for about 10 minutes (hence 4 stars) but you seated yourself. The waiters were not very welcoming but the one who finally waited our table was kind to ask if I needed anything. Food was prompt and they had a great menu. I ordered root beer (I'm sad I forgot the name now but it was a Mexican root beer that had a cinnamon spice to it - delicious!), fresh fruit side and Malibu cheeseburger with goat cheese, spinach, avocado, and roasted red pepper. It was so juicy and perfectly cooked medium rare. I was ecstatic! I love a really well prepared burger any day! I would definitely come back here to try the other parts of the menu or after our baby is born, have a glass of wine. They also have breakfast foods to go as well as wines for sale. It's such a great little hidden gem. Not many interesting people to watch but the food is wonderful and my waiter made up for the initial cold shoulder from the other waiters. It's difficult to find parking but there is a parking garage next door and paid street parking. Great for groups or probably a date in the evening for a glass of wine.
Ordered the veggie hash and egg-whites, really soggy and greasy. Atmosphere is really  nice and cozy. Food comes out really fast. Service is good.

Just went back here today after not having been here in awhile. They had expanded their menu since I had been here and it seems like the prices definitely went up. I used to really enjoy their smaller menu with reasonable prices. It was more of a cafe than a brunch spot. The food is very plain and basic.  It has a cute and cozy atmosphere though. Nice lighting and it usually feels rather cozy. Great scones and nice drink specials during the week nights.

Stopped in for Friday lunch and the place was doing a brisk business.  The decor was beautiful, very warm and traditional.  As you walk in the first thing you notice are the huge scones in the glass case...I don't know why I didn't have one because I love classic scones.  Oh well, an opportunity missed.  I had the chicken curry salad on a baguette and enjoyed it.  My wife had the California salad and her comment was something like "I'll take a southwest salad at MacDo's any day over this."  It was a lot of white lettuce and rather skimpy overall.  Our waiter was inattentive at best.  If he had come by and said "can I interest you in anything else?" I would have had a scone. Now I know why I didn't have one...darn it.

Had breakfast there 2 times while my visit from NYC . My boyfriend had a GIANT amazing French toast w bananas and walnuts - a must try if you not counting those calories ! I had a veggie sandwich with a side Ceesar salad , thumbs up for carrying GLUTEN FREE BREAD for food nerds like me ;)  Service was friendly both times, cool diner with a hip vibe.  Can get pretty crowded for brunch so don't mind a wait

Had a pleasant time here with some friends who lived in the building. Very cosy place, but not in a bad way! Came at 11am on a Sunday and the 4 of us were instantly seated and accomdated. The food was fine, sadly nothing spectacular, but by no means disappointing. They had nice drink specials on Sunday morning, but i didn't try them this time, I had blueberry pancakes and hash browns- no major complaints. The hot chocolate was good. My friend got the Lox meal and it looked very appealing.
Clean, friendly, quick service for lunch. The Ditch Club, with house dill sauce was fantastic. Will return again.
$5 Margaritas night Monday. Lovely stylish vintage space.  Friendly people. Cool rotating local artist artwork on wall for sale. Good homestyle cafe food and reasonable prices. A neighborhood gem.

Cozy cafe style coffee and eatery with a nice relaxed atmosphere. Very nice servers! On Saturdays they serve $5 Bloody Marys, Mimosas and Pimosas. My sister's chai latte was too sweet (although she didn't specify less sugar when she ordered) but the barista graciously added more milk for her.  We didn't eat but found it a nice rest stop on our walk to old town from river north

Unfortunately we had one of the worst customer service experiences in recent memory at 3rd Coast last weekend.  We were staying nearby and stopped there for espresso drinks and juice.  Upon learning that we weren't ordering food, the waiter huffed up and practically yanked the menus out of our hands.  The coffee was great, but he never bothered bringing us the juice.  Feeling unwelcome, we finished our drinks relatively quickly and asked for the check, then waited 10 minutes while our waiter decided to hang out over by the bar.  We finally gave up, left some cash on the table, and walked out.  Needless to say, we will not be returning there.

Had wine and dinner with a few friends on a Monday night. It was fairly empty so service was fast.   Interior and decor remind me of an old speakeasy. It's lounge-y while still feeling like a nice restaurant.  Wine and food selection are great including light options like salad and soup or heavier options like penne and chicken dishes. They even have several gluten free options too.  Wine selection is decent too.  After reading all the reviews, I know I will have to cone back for brunch.

Dim, chill lounge music and warmth. I was looking for a spot for where I'm staying and had to park far away. As soon as I got out I saw this place and decided to eat right away since there's no way I would leave the apt after the walk. It's kind of a little hideaway slightly below ground level that can serve as a place to have coffee or a place to go on a non over the top date. It's great. Everything is simple here and the service was great. I got a Caesar, beef ravioli, and an old fashioned. About 6-8  large well cooked ravioli with garlic bread and shaved parm. The sauce was surprisingly good and everything had good flavor. No complaints for this place.  Easy place to stay and disconnect for awhile. Would definitely recommend.

I've been coming here for years and will continue to come here as long as they have the best coffee I've found in the city. Food is very good, staff is always pleasant, and it's never so busy that you feel rushed or crowded out. But the coffee, oh man the coffee...

Such a wonderful restaurant! I have only been here once, but already have many plans to return. The atmosphere is quaint and comfortable - it does not feel uptight like many of the other wine bars in Chicago. The staff is knowledgable on their wine, as well as wine and food pairings. The food is delicious - our appetizers and main courses were presented beautifully and tasted even better. And of course, you have to get dessert! I highly recommend the key lime pie. What makes this restaurant so dynamic is the owner - she is a kind and caring individual, always ensuring that her guests are happy and satisfied.
Foods great! Just sucks they charge $1.50 per slice of bacon. Place is cute too They have different menu for weekday and weekend brunch

Good location, charming interior in an old building, good food...and unfortunately very mediocre service.  Went with family this AM, was seated promptly and handed menus and water.  Five, ten minutes later (place was busy, not packed) after we had been seated for some time, server arrived.  We just ordered food and it arrived.  She was slow to arrive, never checked to see if we liked it or anything.  The Pancakes were tasty and was the sourdough french toast.  If they had good service, would be a great place to go

I love this place. The food is really amazing. I come here for both breakfast and dinner and both of them are really good. I tried the Mexican breakfast and it was delicious. Also, I tried s burger and it was really good. For sure will keep coming here.
Burger, turkey & Brie sandwich and salad were some of the best we have had in a long time!  Great food, ambience, and service!  Will definitely return again.

The 3rd Coast offers solid breakfast options and we found it after staying nearby at Hotel Indigo since it was just a few doors down. When you enter from Dearborn,  you are in a lobby of an office building and the 3rd Coast is located on the left side. You seat yourself and we had no problems finding a table on a Saturday morning. There were quite a few tables with families with toddlers and it was a nice mixture of Saturday locals and tourists.  We both had omelettes and you get a very hearty portion of hash browns (or your choice of fruit) and then you can pick from an English muffin or different types of toast. I had the house omelette with ham and cheese and peppers and it was very tasty. Our waitress was very attentive and friendly. She said y'all and it was nice to be greeted with Southern Charm while in the Windy City. I saw someone order a stack of pancakes and they looked yummy. We did not wait long for our food and were in an out in no time. All in all, the prices are great and you really get a hearty portion for $11. If there were a 3.5 option, that is what I would rate them.

I should have written this review a long time ago but it never really crossed my mind until I came to 3rd Coast's Yelp page and saw that a few folks had given mediocre reviews. And that offended me to my very core because I feel like this restaurant is like my little baby and I need to protect it! I've come here or ordered carry-out from here probably 25 times over the past year. The Cajun chicken pasta is single handedly at fault for the fact that I can't seem to lose those last five pounds. It's legitimately one of the best pasta dishes I've ever had... And I'm Italian so I have some street cred. If you don't know what to get, you can never go wrong there.  Chopped salad, kale and quinoa salad and coronation chicken salad are amazing - and huge! Sometimes I even get crazy and ask for a scoop of the chicken salad on my kale and quinoa salad. And they do it without question because they're the sweetest people ever and they don't judge my bizarre tastes.  Breakfast is always a trusty go-to as well. Italian omelet with extra marinara is clinically proven to cure hangovers.  It's a great place. All the people are gems. If you're in the hood and you're hungry for ANYTHING at all... This is your no brainer destination.

I practically live off of 3rd Coast. Me, my fiancé, and roommate and friends' have our favorites since we live so close we literally try everything on the menu. Just off the top of my head: - stuffed French toast - to die for - veggie hash - amazing breakfast staple if you want something kind of healthy. The texture itself is amazing - the clubs are good - the desserts are generous - Cajun penne pasta - YES. Just the right amount of spice - spinach Caesar salad - not sure if it's the fresh Parmesan or the amazing dressing or the perfectly done croutons... But everything is soooo good - kale quinoa salad - so so good. Get it with chicken - Coffee - yesssssss - scones - Delish - there are gluten free versions of almost everything (pasta, brownies, etc) Perfect place for late night food - they are open later than a lot of surrounding places, and the atmosphere is perfect for groups of 6 and under or a casual date. Great for conversation and service is always fast.  We order and pick up sometimes too and it's ridiculously fast (like 15 minutes before it's ready). Enjoy!!!

This is an awesome spot for lunch. Very close to where I work so I figured I'd check it out because they had a good selection of salads. Ordered the California salad to go and it was GREAT. They also have Whiskey Wednesdays (which I have gone to yet, but will definitely check out one of these days). I am impressed and will definitely be going back.

This review is for the coffee and scone alone because they deserve it.  I rarely ever have good coffee at restaurants that serve breakfast and growing up in the SeaTac area I know a good cup of coffee when I taste one. I absolutely hate weak, watered down coffee, but don't worry The 3rd Coast has you covered.  You are going to get a cup of strong, flavorful coffee that leaves you wanting more.  Now, the scone....I chose the Blueberry one, but I should've ordered all three (there were also chocolate and raspberry)! But I knew I was going to get a fatty deep dish pizza later on so I told myself to simmer down.  The scone was fluffy yet dense..I don't even know if that is possible...it was like eating a special dessert and they serve it with whipped cream =) for $3.95 I thought it was well worth it.  Definitely want to go back and try their breakfast specialties.

3rd coast is the go-to restaurant in the area at any reasonable hour for breakfast, lunch, dinner, drinks, coffee & desserts the way you like them... In an age of snooty breakfasts with snooty ingredient lists and snooty prices, This is the kind of place I feel blessed to have so close. Your presence in the neighborhood helps retain its integrity and not lose hold of reality. Thank you, 3rd Coast!

Get the scones! They were really delicious and well made. The rest of the food we ordered was rather good, as well. The service was good, even with our clumsy, coffee spilling group. They were really accommodating for our party when we switched seats, needed a larger table, etc. Would definitely pop in for the scones on their own - absolutely delicious.

My boyfriend and I decided to come here for brunch upon a recommendation from the hosts of the Airbnb we were staying at. It was only a few blocks away so we decided to give it a try. It was around 11 am on a Wednesday, so it wasn't too busy.  Since we weren't that hungry, we decided to share the Mexican steak and eggs (grilled skirt steak, melted cheese, corn or flour tortillas and pico de gallo, with hash browns). Everything was really bland. I don't think I would have been able to eat it without the hot sauce or ketchup that they had. We ordered the steak medium rare, but it was really medium well. The only thing good about this place was probably the coffee.They also seem like they have pretty good drink specials each night, but we didn't get to try that. So my advice? Stick to liquids only. Or at least avoid the Mexican steak and eggs.

I live in the building upstairs and am constantly over... The food is okay nothing too special and they have screwed up my order several times or forgotten to include something....but the coffee is usually pretty good... they make fresh scones and sweets which are worth trying... one thing i will say is that the service is awesome, the staff are really nice and friendly which can be rare in the city!!!
Quick service and our meals were great. Hidden under an apartment building so it was a little hard to find.

You can smell the scent of coffee from outside. The restaurant is to the left after you enter the vestibule for some condos. This location is close to my home so I have been here a couple of times for Sunday brunch. Today it was a Saturday brunch so it was less busy and there was no wait for a table. I had the curry chicken salad sandwich which was good, my cousin had the chilaquiles which she said was hot (and she eats spicy food) and had to ask to a glass of milk. Overall a nice experience and very convienant. Probably will be back because its so close and has breakfast options.

We came here to have a late breakfast and were very happy with our orders. I ordered the polish sausage which was delicious! My husband ordered the Mexican steak and loved it. Both came with generous servings and were cooked the way we liked them. Coffee was just okay and the service wasn't the best, but I think it was just the waitress we had. Other wait staff had to come over and fill our drinks and bring and take our plates. Would definitely recommend for the food.

We stayed close to the 3rd Coast and decided to give it a try. It has great ambiance licated just below street level. The seevice was friendly and fast and tge food was delicious. I had the Benedicto, eggs benedict on toasted French bread slices with ham, arugula and pesto - great choice. The kids each had the Buttermilk pancakes and they were not able to finish their portions. Overall a great experience including the hot and cold chocolates and the Cappucini I had.

Hard to find a solid brunch spot in this neighborhood but this one is on point. The veggie hash was amazing. Bloody Mary's come with a ghost cheese that's deliciously spicy and for $5 above avg. I wish they had some outdoor seating but can see this being a cozy place for the winter months

We came here for brunch on a Thursday morning. The restaurant is really cozy and has a laid back cafe fee. We ordered the smoked polish sausage with eggs and hash browns and the bacon and eggs.  The food is amazing and the service was fantastic. Our server was really friendly and always made sure our coffee and water was filled. What a great way to start the morning, I would come back in a heartbeat!

We were here for any early breakfast on a Sunday, so it was super quiet. Great breakfast though - I had the stuffed french toast with brie, walnuts, bananas, and banana liqueur. Lovely and filling. Coffee on demand too. Service was great and it's relatively inexpensive.

What a fine casual dining experience!  Such a comfortable setting. Great menu with daily specials.  Wonderful homemade soups du jour truly taste like mother made.  An almost perfect - fresh as can be - Cobb Salad - the only thing missing is the chopped egg. Service is excellent.  Prices won't give you "sticker shock."  Even when it hosts a crowd, The 3rd Coast maintains a pleasantly conversational tone.  For all of these reasons, The 3rd Coast is fine dining that you'll want to experience again and again.  Two thumbs up and a high five!

What a great find! I'm from California and this is my last day her in Chicago. I needed to find a great lunch place around town and this one caught my eye.  I'm sure glad I picked it. It's inside the hotel entrance to the side.  The ambience is divey but the food is delicious. If you get a burger cooked under well I suggest you get an extra napkin! The meat was juicy and everything went perfectly together. A great well balanced burger goes great with the Ceasar salad.  I'm very happy I chose this place. I would definitely come back again!

The Italian omelet is something I crave on a regular basis because 3rd Coast is so close to my home. The food is always top notch in quality and is served promptly after ordering. The lox and creme cheese dish is also a great morning treat.  For dinner, their specials are great too. The ravioli is scrumptious and the soups are divine!  The staff is friendly. The wait times can be a downer on the weekend mornings for the "brunch rush."

Service pretty underwhelming. Still waiting to put in our order after 5-10 minutes. After putting it in, the wait from the kitchen was also quite long - 20 minutes for tacos and a sandwich. So the service is 2 star, the food itself was quite good, I give it 4 stars. The decor, 3 stars. I don't like hard ceilings that reflect the noise and raise the volume level in a restaurant. It wasn't "I can't hear you talk" loud, but it was irritating.

For those of you who are not familiar with the Great Lakes, the 3rd coast refers to them.  You got your East Coast on the Atlantic, your West Coast on the Pacific, and the 3rd coast along the Great Lakes.  Some claim that the 3rd coast refers to the Gulf Coast.  Sorry y'all, but the earliest reference was a Milwaukee Mayor using it to attract business.  He preferred it to the region being referred to as the Rust Belt. Anyway, now that the history lesson.  Let's head to the other 3rd Coast; the one on Dearborn Street in Chicago. Every neighborhood has a "go to" spot.  When I lived on the Gold Coast many years ago, it was Monday's on State or Mitchell's at North and Clark.  They are gone and 3rd Coast has come along to take the honors. It's located on the corner of Goethe ("ger-tah" if you speak Chicago - or German, I assume) and Dearborn.  It is just off of the lobby of an apartment building.  When you enter, the first thing you may notice is the sizable adult beverage area with 2 dining rooms on either side of the bar/cashier; one up and one down. The décor is fairly non-descript, but not in an unattractive way.  The walls are festooned with several dozen pieces of for sale artwork.  Many are Chicago-centric, but I've yet to find one that would seem to go with the "3rd Coast" moniker (read: nautical themed). The menu is what I would describe as "current diner".  Breakfast is served all day with nice spins on the classics.  I really like the Chicago-style smoked polish sausage with eggs.  While I'm not sure it meets my definition of "Chicago-style" it is very good.  The split Smokey goodness plays wonderfully with an over-medium egg.  Actually, I like the combo much more than bacon and eggs. The salads are generous.  The Waldorf is one of my favorites; greens, apples, goat cheese and walnuts all work together to deliver a surprisingly satisfying lunch or lighter dinner.  I've heard great things about the Kale/Quinoa and the Cobb salads as well.  Although, I will admit, I've never had them because I am always distracted by... ...the Diablo tacos!  Man, are they good.  You get a full plate with soft corn tortillas each carefully loaded with ground beef, onions, cilantro, cabbage, and avocado.  It also comes with this wonderful "medium" hot sauce.  It's got to be house made because the color is not one that would be favored by commercial food marketers.  The cabbage offers a nice crisp bite as the seasoned ground beef and onions bring a savory note and a bit of spice for the avocado to smooth over.  I'm not an expert on Mexican street food, but this is actually fairly close to what I remember, right down to the squeeze of lime and NO CHEESE.  I know, right?  Sounds crazy, but my Mexican friends tell me the cheese on tacos is not as universal as Taco Bell would have us believe. The other really bright spots for this neo-diner are the burgers.  In my experience, it really doesn't matter; the Baja, Malibu, Niece, Cajun, or 3rd Coast burgers are all worthy of a try.  Fresh ground beef with just the right amount of fat is what makes these juicy-run-down-your-hand-but-not-your-arm yummy bombs.  Hey!  I eat here during the work day and my dress shirts have to remain presentable.  So, I'm OK with a 3 on the messy-meter. Now, I will also tell you that I hear the scones are terrific.  I've never had one, but several of my fellow Yelpers swear by them.  So, there you go.  I've also not experienced the place in the evening when it supposedly is more of a hip wine bar type of place.  Not exactly my crowd, but I'm sure the dinner offerings are just as solid. The 3rd Coast is definitely NOT 3rd rate!

Came here for breakfast and the food was good, nothing extraordinary in terms of taste or presentation. Fine place to grab breakfast or coffee - perhaps a little overpriced for what it was, but reasonable considering the area.
Love this place they have great lunch menu and desserts are awesome it's a hidden gem in the neighborhood recommended and nice ambiance for friends or a date. Prices are decent and service is good.
First time ordering from 3rd coast ever. Literarily just picked up the food..and this is what I get? #fail

Great place for breakfast. Food was delay and plentiful. Some of the best coffee around. Service was just ok but in there defense they were super busy with a wait to sit down. Will definitely go back!
Great breakfast food and coffee.  The eggs Benedict was outstanding.  Gets quite busy on the weekends.  They also seem to have a good wine selection

Recovering from a wrap up of The Grateful Dead three night run- this place was a stones throw from the Indigo Hotel- perfect meal! We had the cheese platter sampler that was just perfect and then I went into a Quinoa/Kale with Chicken salad.  Delicious. The vibe was cool and the staff were super attentive and friendly. Recommend it if you are in the neighborhood.
I love this place. Coffee is phenomenal as is all the breakfast options. I eat here way too much!!

- Food is almost always good, and the burgers are awesome! Brussel sprouts and the apple pie ala mode are a must try. - The feel inside is really unique, and at night the ambiance is classy-cool. Classic old Chicago building and located in a fairly quiet, historic area of the city. - Staff is nice, however my takeout orders have been messed up more times than not. They commonly forget one or two of the dishes ordered and once even forgot one of the buns on my burger (??).  - The manager was kind of pretentious when she asked how our food was, and she seemed like she was more interested in telling us about her then actually caring how the meal was. Solid 3 stars for this place, but still worth checking out I'd say, especially late night.
Cool spot with a great atmosphere.  Food is delicious service fast and courteous.  If your in the Gold Coast and want a great meal in a quaint and quiet place this hits the spot.

The diablo beef sandwich is a great take on the classic italian beef sandwich, on a great chewy baguette with spicy giardinera. Wine and craft beer list leave nothing to be desired. A favorite neighborhood spot

I've been coming here for years and there is a reason it's been around so long: quality! Great neighborhood food and reasonable prices . Open late and also family friendly. Nice wine. Love the support of the local art!!

This is a solid four star restaurant.  I came here with my friend on a Wednesday afternoon.  There were a couple tables occupied and we sat ourselves right away.  I had the house omelet with a chocolate chip scone.  Both were delicious.  I never thought to serve a scone with whipped cream, but I'm sold.  The only thing that kind of bothered me was the server.  Yeah, he was the only server and he had a couple other tables to take care of, but I still don't think that's an excuse for rude behavior.  We sat awhile before he brought over our menus and even then he just dropped them on the table without a word.  When he came back all he said was, "ready?" Oh well, the great food made up for it.

I came here mid/late afternoon after exploring a museum and was absolutely famished. My friend had looked the place up via yelp and said "whatever I get, I'm also getting a scone on the side, so don't judge!". I would NEVER judge a person for wanting a delicious breakfast food, and as soon as I passed the pastry case with them inside, saw they had raspberry, and that it was served with whipped cream, I had need for one as well! Their menu and pics posted by fellow yelpers made my decision all too difficult. Everything sounded great! I kept flipping the menu back and forth before I decided on a burger. I was pleasantly surprised to see that soup was a side option, as well as hash browns or a salad. There was the slightest inkling of a chill in the air so I went with a cup of their spicy garbanzo barley soup, the Baja Burger and the raspberry scone.  The waiter working seemed to be the only one managing the register and all the tables. It wasn't super busy, but for one person, I guess it was kind of a lot. He dropped menus on the table that he'd just taken from another table, and by the first time he came around to greet us, it was already decision time for all the food. He came off as a little rushed and abrupt. We ordered food, and diet cokes and began our tortuous wait.  I was a little disappointed to see that the pops were served in cans. AKA- no free refills. Bummer, could've used a little more of that caffiene! Food came out relatively shortly after, and everything was delicious. I LOVED the soup- mild spice, loaded with beans and barley... I'm definitely going to hunt out a recipe for it! The burger was juicy, a little greasy, had a decent amount of avocado on it and TONS of pepperjack cheese- Just what the doctor ordered! The scone was quite large, had a fair amount of raspberries on it, and was also pretty good. It wasn't a life changing experience, I'd say the soup was the closest food item for that.  My friend ordered similar with an omelet meal, scone and coke. We left with leftovers and our total was like $42. I thought it was reasonable for what we got. I'd come back again.

I always get the 3rd Coast Burger well done. Service is great and I never have any issues with my food order. Employees are very attentive and always check in frequently too make sure everything is good. Caesar salad is good but for some reason they do not serve fries..especially with the burger. Either salad or hashbrowns. Still would recommend.

I was going to give it 4 stars because of the slow service, but the food was really tasty. Bought the chicken and penne in Alfredo sauce, opted for the spicy flavor. It wasn't that spicy but tasted great and there was a lot! Great ambience and perfect for a date.

Third Coast is a very special place. I've been coming to this delish joint since I was 10 years old. Because it was in the neighborhood, parents gave us permission to get lunch and dinner with friends at Third Coast. We wrote the 5th grade newspaper on those tables, we gossiped about high school crushes while waiting for our raspberry scones to be warmed in our teens, and now that I live in New York, I also stop in to get a perfect cup of coffee or a glass of vino with some live jazz, and, of course, a trip down memory lane.  I'm jealous of everyone who gets to call Third Coast their neighborhood hang out.

Food is excellent and portions are large, so I think 5 stars would normally be appropriate. However, the service was very poor, which is the reason for the 2 star review. My wife and I were looking for a quick, hearty breakfast on a cold Sunday morning. After living in the city for 8 years we finally decided to give 3rd Coast a try. When we walked in the restaurant was noticeably slow.  We asked a a larger table, but were quickly informed those are reserved for groups of 4. While I generally understand this policy, I can't help but think they could've accommodated our request. After all, the restaurant was not busy at all. They sat us in a very tight corner table. So close, in fact, it was difficult to have a private conversation. My wife asked what kind of muffins are available. Seemingly, a very simple question; however, the waitress quickly snapped, "we don't have muffins, we only have scones."  From the looks of the display case, the pastries could easily be mistaken for muffins. Our apologies for asking such a silly question!  We ended up leaving before we finished our food as we found it very annoying to share our conversation with total strangers at the adjacent table. When we left, the restaurant was less crowded than when we walked in. I find this level of service unacceptable. Despite the good food, we will not be coming back. Thank you for an unenjoyable morning 3rd Coast.

Solid place with a full spectrum of food.  Its basically a typical greek diner - very similar to ones you find throughout NJ and around Boston - but rather then a stand alone presence it's located in the base of a Gold Coast high-rise apt building.

Quiet,  cozy little diner with a great Chicago Beef sandwich and caesar salad.  It's a little hard to find the place,  but once you do,  you won't regret it!  I just moved here and will be coming back to this place to try another sandwich!

I stop in to get something to take out.  The Menu price was ok for this part of town. I order the spinach  salad , lemon chicken and the muscles.  The server greeted me, and was very personable. Everything was clean the atmosphere was nice and mellow, and I will come back. Rob

Breakfast is a mainstay and always decent, but the atmosphere is the big draw.  This year they finally updated their menu, adding some items that actually taste pretty good, but still nothing special. The service is terrific and the staff is friendly.  Carryout is never good.  Portions are always smaller, and they notoriously skimp on ingredients,  Smoked turkey and Brie has become turkey with a hint of cheese. Not a destination place, that's for sure, but nice if it's raining and you live close by.

Long ago in a decade called the 90's, this was our favorite go-to place for breakfast.  It was a charming coffee shop offering a good meal (loved their scones!) with friendly service. So, when a friend was visiting from London and staying at the Public Chicago hotel, which is just a block away, The 3rd Coast seemed the perfect place to go for breakfast. It's still charming and, at 9am, was fairly quiet. Just five other people were dining. (That changed quickly and, by the time we left, the place was crowded. So go early if you don't want to wait for a seat. ) Three sleepy-eyed, yawning girls stood behind the counter when we entered. No one greeted us. We asked if we could take any table and were told yes. The friendliest and hardest worker in the restaurant was the busboy. When no one came to take our order, he went and got us coffee and summoned a waitress, who'd been "busy" talking to the other servers at the counter. I'm guessing that no manager or owner was around because the service remained ridiculously slow and the servers showed little interest in working.  Our breakfast fare (omelettes) was fine. Nothing spectacular but decent. It's a cute place and, if the service was better, it'd be worth a return visit.
Perfect brunch place - delightful cozy setting, delicious pancakes, super fast and friendly service.

I live in the Gold Coast and ever since I found out that you can do take out from this place, my life (in the neighborhood) changed for good. I always get the Cajun burger with a side of Ceasar Salad, even that simple Ceasar salad is amazing!!! Give this place a try.

Decent food. Nothing special. Cozy environment except the annoying machine that makes this sound like someone is closing down one of those folding metal door each time it is used.  Staff is friendly when they talk to you. She only checked back once after the food was served. Is coffee is not refillable? I wasn't even asked if i wanted another. My empty plate has been sitting in front of me for 12 minutes while I'm writing this review. And other servers pretty much just walk past me since they are not my server, I'm guessing. Still waiting for the check. Verdict: Not coming back. A lot of other options around.

Excellent food here. Love the atmosphere and the quirky decorations. Very unique. I wish there was a bit more room inbetween some of the tables as I feel like I do not have my own space. Also you are constantly bumping people when trying to be seated or leave because of the tightness. Overall a great experience though and I will be back!

Came here at 9 on a Sunday morning and while it was busy it was not packed. A little unusual for a Chicago eatery with good reviews. I had the Mexican omelette and my wife had fruit and granola. Both dishes were excellent. Also got a peak at the food next to us and they said the same thing. Not sure about the things said about the coffee I thought it was great. Service and speed of food was excellent

I really wish nobody knew about this place, because I want it to myself. I get there lox or polish sausage for brunch, or their Mediterranean salad for lunch. The dressing in that salad is out of this world. Not sure how life would be without this salad, and that has to mean something because I would choose a steak over a salad any day any time.  Cheers!

This was my favorite place for breakfast/brunch when I lived in the gold coast. Hardly ever had to wait for a table, which is nice when you wake up hungry and hungover and need 'dat bacon asap. Plus their bacon... So. Effing. Good.  Also their coffee is fantastic as well! The only qualm I've ever run into is that the toast is sometimes too soft and not toasted enough. But I guess that's an easy fix by just telling your server to double toast it!

They staff is friendly and patient, the food comes out fast and fresh from the skillet or ya know, they have a nice selection on their menu but I would like to see more.  They are open pretty late and I never have to wait long for a table. Great spot!

I'd go hear if I lived within 5 minutes walking distance, otherwise 3rd Coast is pretty standard, if not a bit simple for what you're paying for. The clientele is older and more wealthy than you'd find at other brunch places, hence the moderate noise level which is nice. This would be a great place to meet a friend or have a small business meeting for a light breakfast/snack. I appreciate the ambiance inside, which has this upscale, old-time cafe feel to it. You get the sense that maybe a famous author wrote her books in the corner, or that politicians come here regularly to have a coffee while they scheme away. Speaking of which, Rahm just beat Chuy in yesterday's runoff. Shocker.

Delicious breakfast, super fast and friendly service even during a really busy time.  Try a flavored latte-the hazelnut one was delicious!! I got the banana pecan pancakes and hash browns and they were delicious. Would definitely return!
I live across the street, so it might be a little too conveniently located. Okay food, nice spot to just go and relax with a dessert and drink. Staff is attentive and doesnt rush you out at all!

Great Neighborhood spot! Salmon, Omelet and Kale/Quinoa salad all good. Friendly service. Recommend for brunch or an easy sit down meal in the bustling gold coast. The only thing I found odd, was the chicken breast added to my salad was buried underneath the kale and everything else, kinda strange?

Veggie hash was fresh and delicious! Chilaquiles dish was full of flavor and so good!  Mimosas were perfect! A splash of oj for color. Just the way I like!  Great vibe!  Friendly staff!  Very enjoyable!  I will definitely be coming back soon!
We went here for brunch. This place was really yummy, reasonably priced, nice ambiance, and good, quick service. Would recommend !

The food is amazing for the price you pay. First, its a hipster environment that's laid back and easy going which makes the place feel welcoming and friendly. The food is great. The breakfast food is fantastic and I will be going back more often. The service is quick and prompt. It's not a fancy place with fancy food if that is what you're looking for. If you want to go out in jeans and shirt, this is your place.

Great service and food. Stopped in for a quick lunch during work day. The waitress was quick with our order so we could make it back to work in time. Cute rustic feel, would definitely go back to spend a little more time and enjoy the atmosphere

I'd say 4.5, I need to chill on my 5 star reviews. I just moved to the neighborhood a few weeks ago...LOVE it btw, and this is already one of my go-to's. I work crazy, odd hours, and love their 12 am closing time. I'm notorious for dining alone, but also need somewhere to take my daughter, or God forbid a date these days. This place can accommodate all 3. Its not the most stylish restaurant by any means, but charming. And you'll never feel like a douche dining alone. (Who does is a weirdo anyway. We are all adults and need to eat) I'm NOT a breakfast fan, so I can't comment on that, but their Asian noodle soup is amazing. I could eat soup everyday, and am picky about it, and this is great. Quesadillas are good, and my daughter loves the meatballs.  I can't comment on the recognition of regulars. I've been about 10 times in 6 weeks and haven't gotten that super friendly vibe I get at Mario's. But I'll keep coming back.
Great place to go in Chicago for a quick bite to eat or late night snack.

Lunch time!! My colleague and I decided to try this place because it is close to work. I ordered the chicken greek salad and she ordered the BLT.  5 stars for service-- you can set up an order for pick up or delivery (they do deliver!!!) but we ordered pick up and it was ready in 15 minutes...awesome!! 2 stars for food -- This is based solely on my salad, I will update this if I try other things. However, I was not impressed with the salad. It was $14 and tasted like a $5 salad. First of all, the chicken added to the salad is cold (I prefer warm chicken) and tasted okay. It was a bit dry and had to warm it up. They did give the right amount. The salad itself was very bland and not dressed up at all. I ordered the dressing on the side, Greek dressing very good! The BLT was on Texas toast, large and average.  I will try this place once more but for now, I was not wowed (and I have been eating A LOT OF SALADS for the upcoming wedding :) ).  This salad is one of my least favorites that I have tried in the past two months.  However, I suggest trying their breakfast menu, I have heard that it is very tasty and let me know :)

Casual, fun, cozy, warming, welcoming...I could go on with the humble positive adjectives. When it comes to brunch, this is a restaurant worth checking out. The staff is wonderful. I think the prices are pretty reasonable in my opinion. Service is top notch. Food is much better than your typical bar grub, that is for sure.  Key lime is a must try!

A great brunch place with little or no wait and better food and prices than the local competition.  I have lived in the Gold Coast for nearly a decade now and this is my go to breakfast place.  That is unless I want to sit outside...then I go to Tavern. The omelets are great, but you really can't go wrong here.  I have never disliked a dish. Good, relaxed atmosphere and service.  My only criticism is that the short brunette weekday morning waitress kind of has a crap attitude.

I've been remiss in posting this. I've lived around the corner from this little delicious place for 4 years. It's truly a place where everyone knows your name. The food is pretty incredible. The menu has something on it for everyone. I often get the tuna melt and for real - they cook it to perfection. Their wine selection is also great. I've had breakfast, lunch and dinners here. If you're looking for a local place that's warm and inviting...with a great menu where everyone comes out of the kitchen tasting great, then 3rd Coast is your place.

Went here for brunch on a Sunday and walked right in with no wait. The place is small and simply decorated, nothing fancy. The food was good; I had a BLT and hash browns (BLT was mediocre but the hash browns were great) and my friends all got various omelets and pancakes which they said were good. Overall, I would recommend if you are in the area and need a brunch place without a wait, but I think there are certainly better/nicer places around if you are trying to impress someone or have visitors from out of town.

I think the 3rd Coast is your typical American brunch food housed in a decently nice area which naturally increases the price for food. I got the Eggs Florentine with hash browns which was tasty but really nothing out of the extraordinary and nothing that screamed at me to return again. I loved the abundant amount of spinach on the benedict though! Ingredients tasted fresh but there was too much sauce on my benedicts which made the English muffin overly mushy and soggy.  Seats are way too close together. It almost gives me anxiety.  A very short wait for Sunday brunch so it's a good place to come if you're not up for waiting more than 15 minutes. Food is also served pretty quickly. Props on good service from the folks working there.

Stopped by here after a shred class and was craving something hearty/hot. I ordered the coconut oatmeal (comes with bananas, added raisins) was a little pricey at $9, but portion was large enough that I had it for both breakfast and lunch. Cafe was relatively empty and service was pretty friendly, so I ended up staying awhile and writing postcards and having a couple cups of coffee. This would be a nice place to catch up with a friend or enjoy some alone time and I will definitely check it out next time I'm in Chicago.
One of my favorite brunch spots. The food is great. The friendliness of the staff is awesome. Why 4 stars? Service is a bit slow for my taste. I try to go there when I'm not on a tight schedule.

Just had an amazing hamburger. Served on pretzel bun, goat cheese, fresh spinach, roasted peppers and avocado.    Is your mouth watering....it should.  Trying breakfast tomorrow. .I don't think I'll be disappointed.

Been there a few more times since my last review and want to add that I've had their Norwegian Lox and Bagel sandwich which was absolutely delicious.  Their lox was excellent, not salty, extremely tasty, and the preparation on the plate was very appetizing with vegetables.  I love their lox sandwiches. Quantity and quality of the lox was excellent.  There's no need to look in the city and drive all over looking for a good lox and bagel sandwich.  I think their lox is much better than other delis in the city and their bagels are much better too. Wish they would have chive cream cheese in addition to plain though. Service as always was excellent.
Kinda of an adorable place with great food. Check was slow and no one came to give change. Good thing I didn't need it.

I like going here! Great food, music, cozy ambiance. CLEAN. We're often seated right away. Relatively quiet during Saturday brunch hours, which is a relief. Food is pretty standard compared to other brunch spots. I really like that the bar is this prominent, dark wooden structure, BAM in the middle of the restaurant instead of tucked in a corner. As for other aspects of the decor, I didn't find anything extraordinary or jarring. It's more expensive than you would expect at a neighborhood cafe / diner. At the same time, it is Old Town (Clark/Division), so I guess they've got to break even somehow.

I had the lox Benedict, which was excellent - I really liked the salsa verde. The café au lait was good. My friend had the Greek omelette, which she enjoyed. Service was pretty good. Quintessential breakfast spot atmosphere. Would definitely come back.

Very quiet today here. Friday at 11am. The service is very good. The restaurant is a decent size and very clean. Lovely menu items. Have to get the Scone. I had the blueberry. Yummy! Overall, everything was very good.
The veggie hash is quite possibly the best breakfast dish I've ever had.  Service is also fantastic.

Overall: Cozy and homey little cafe great for breakfast/brunch/lunch or a casual dining experience. The Good: Atmosphere is comforting and easy going. Service is very friendly and attentive, my coffee was always full. The food was excellent and portioned just right, and came out pretty quickly fresh and ready. The bad: Not much! Even the music was pretty good. Atmosphere: 9/10 Service: 9/10 Food: 9/10
Fantastic, consistently good food, always. A great tucked away neighborhood place.  Service is above average and kitchen is unbelievably fast.

Would give 10 stars if I could based on:  food; ambience; service; location; weather; plus a bonus, Janet, the owner, is a doppelgänger for Lily Rabe and her enthusiasm and passion for what she does shows.--no attention to detail was overlooked; from the freshly painted coat room to the custom menu for our prix fixe menu. Charming and beautiful hostess not afraid to roll up her sleeves and lead her staff by example (nice boots too ;-).  Chris, (the other owner) is also very knowledgeable and accommodating. After a fantastic 7 course dinner--everything was indescribably excellent but the fish tacos were even more superb than excellent (I run out of adjectives for how great they were) Chris turned us on to a great B.L.U.E.S. Bar down the street.  So great, that despite having just had dinner, I am coming back for breakfast tomorrow as I hear their bacon is to die for (which is appropriate dice bacon is probably the worst ting one can eat while at the same time tasting like the best thing ever). Come here soon. Come here often.  You will not be disappointed.

I stumbled upon this place serendipitously while walking today.  I was getting hungry, and tucked in the middle of a residential neighborhood, I found my solution. Clearly a local favorite, the cozy under street cafe has dark wood accents and brown leather booth seating.   I started with a cafe au lait that was steaming hot and softly sweet. Perfect for warming up on a cold day.  Then I ordered the BLT and side Caesar.  The salad was the star of the meal, but the sandwich was butter toasted and loaded with thick, expertly grilled bacon.

Adorable little local spot. Great service. We popped in for breakfast. started with a hot hot Apple cider. I had a hard time deciding between the veggie hash or the coconut oatmeal. Decided on the hash it was perfect! Crunchy, hot, lots of broccoli, runny eggs. Yumm They have gluten free and vegan options, locally sourced foods, organic ingredients.

Wow. Just wow. Had to give stars for the food but absolutely zero for service. Went in today (there were only two other tables seated) and had the most unpleasant experience with a female server I have ever had in my entire life. Walked in and didn't get a hi, hello or anything, just muttered "Sit wherever you want"  I sit down. Again, no hi, hello, introduction NOTHING no smile ever. She just goes "Are you ready?" What is wrong with you, woman? My whole entire time dining she said maybe four words and did not smile once. What a miserable human being.  Here's a tip: If you don't enjoy serving or working in the service industry, please find something more suitable for you.  She was so unfriendly that I didn't even feel welcomed in the restaurant and uncomfortable as ever. I paid my bill and left immediately so I wouldn't have to deal with her any longer.  Have no idea who decided to hire her as a server but they definitely lost business from my friends and I. I live in the neighborhood and work at a hotel within walking distance and will not be recommending this place, ever.  Their food is great but their service is awful, good luck.
